repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Financial System Infrastructure
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Financial System
            Infrastructure Modernization Project in Algeria were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: 1) The Bank took the
            calculated risk to finance this project in order to create
            some momentum in the development of the financial sector in
            Algeria. Rather than waiting for the perfect environment and
            for all the elements to be in place, the Bank and the
            Government of Algeria went forward. One restructuring and
            one extension later, this proved to be the right decision;
            2) The downgrading of the project to
            "unsatisfactory" at mid-term review was a good
            decision to create a momentum and get the project back on
            track; 3) The personal involvement of the Governor of the
            Central bank to mobilize relevant people inside the Central
            Bank and outside demonstrated the importance of a
            "Champion" in the success of a project; 4) The
            choice of shifting to a more efficient and cheaper
            technology for the Telecom infrastructure was not easy but
            at the end was definitely the right one; 5) Lack of
            specialized staff at the Bank, Algeria-Telecom and the PIU
            regarding the new technology in Telecom infrastructure
            caused some delays in the procurement process; 6) The
            information systems of commercial banks were outside the
            scope of the project. This is preventing them from fully
            benefiting from the Real Time Gross Settlement System; 7)
            Security issues regarding the telecom network should have
            been addressed at the inception of the project as part of
            development objectives; and 8) Training issues regarding the
            new technology used could have been better managed during
            the implementation of the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Financial System Infrastructure
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of this restructuring is
            to refocus the scope of the Financial System Infrastructure
            Modernization Project, given the decision of the Bank of
            Algeria to fund the information systems component, with its
            own resources. This refocus is linked to a reduction of the
            loan amount to reflect this change, and cost savings that
            occurred due to technological improvements under the other
            components (the Real Time Gross Settlement System -RTGS -
            and the telecommunications components). The Algerian
            authorities have also requested an extension of the project
            closing date to allow them fulfill the project's
            development objectives. It is important to note that the
            statements and policies of the Government and of the Bank of
            Algeria in support of global payments systems reform, proves
            (and ensures) the commitment to see the project objectives
            achieved, and to further engage in additional payments
            systems reform which would help strengthen the financial
            infrastructure, and would support the sector's role in
            economic and private sector growth. The restructuring
            satisfactorily complies with the Articles of Agreement of
            the Association and the Bank, and it is recommended that
            project restructuring be approved.

repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Financial System Infrastructure
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objective of the
            Financial System Infrastructure Modernization Project, is to
            put in place an enabling infrastructure for basic financial
            services, primarily by modernizing the inter-bank payments
            system for large-value transactions, and, by developing
            norms, and standards for low-value payments systems. Key
            components address: 1) the development of a modernized
            inter-bank payments system, allowing to process electronic
            fund transfers, and facilitate secure, rapid transfers. A
            Real Time Gross Settlements System (RTGS) will be
            established, to be managed, and operated by the Bank of
            Algeria (BA). For this purpose, procedures will be
            incorporated to control credit risk, fraud, and maintain
            integral, confidential transactions. Subcomponents include:
            computerization, technical assistance and training, and,
            studies to identify interface standards for clearing banking
            activity payments; 2) the information systems of the BA,
            which will include the technical infrastructure for the RTGS
            system, computer hardware, and software, supported by
            technical assistance (TA), and training for both the RTGS
            system, and information systems in general; 3)
            telecommunications infrastructure support, involving a high
            capacity telecommunications optical ring network in Algiers,
            with links around the country; telecommunications hardware,
            and software installation; TA, and training for
            telecommunications engineering, and security audits; and, 4)
            project management support, which includes, inter alia, TA,
            and training to strengthen the project management unit capacity.
